SUBJECT: Rights/Others
DETAILS: Trent Ltd. had informed the Exchange that the Directors had considered raising of additional long-term funds for the Company's growth pland and had decided to make a Rights Issue of Equity Shares of an amount of Rs. 130 Crores and a simultaneous but unlinked Rights Issue of Non-Convertible Bonds with Warrants of an amount of about Rs. 200 Crores. The company has now informed the Exchange that at the meeting of the Board of Directors of the Company held on October 10,2006, the Directors have re-considered the earlier financing structure and it has now been decided to raise a part of the total funds required through - (A) A Preferential Issue of Equity Shares with attached Warrants to the Promoters and thereafter, (B) A Rights Issue of Equity Shares to all the Shareholders. The earlier proposal to have a simultaneous but unlinked Rights Issue of Non-convertible bonds with Warrants has been dropped. The quantum of Warrants to be issued on Preferential basis would also not exceed 5% of the existing Share Capital. While the Preferential Issue of Equity Shares would be allotted during the current financial year 2006-07, the Warrants would have the right to subscribe to Equity Shares only in the next financial year 2007-08. The terms and the price of the Preferential issue of Shares and Warrants will be in accordance with SEBI (Disclosure and Investor Protection) Guidelines. The Total amount through this issue is expected to be between Rs. 100 Crores to Rs. 120 Crores over two financial years. (B) Immediately after the Preferential issue to the Promoters, it has been decided to issue Equity Shares on a Rights basis to the existing Shareholders in the ratio of 1:5 at a price of Rs. 500/- per share. The issue size is estimated to be in the range from Rs. 152 Crores to Rs. 165 Crores.
